intro: Senecio bodinieri var. brevior, commonly known as the dwarf ice plant, is a compact, low-growing succulent native to South Africa. It features dense clusters of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically blue-green in color, with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces showy, daisy-like yellow flowers in late summer, adding ornamental value to rock gardens or containers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, requiring minimal water once established. Due to its slow growth and compact form, it is ideal for small spaces and xeriscaping.
